oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Military compass and leather carrying case
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This military compass is threaded for mounting on a Jacob's staff. The bottom is marked with a "broad arrow" denoting British government property and "No. 108406" with "1917." The rim is divided and marked in five degree increments with corresponding compass directions below. The leather case is marked "T.J. BUTFIELD LTD" with "1918." below. It belonged to Pvt. James McFerren Johnston, HQ Co., Ord Corps which was attached to the 114th MG Battn., 30th Div.
